   19: %%
   20: -module(erlc_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: %% Tests the erlc command by compiling various types of files.
   23: 
   24: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   25:          init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   26:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   27:          compile_erl/1,
   28:          compile_yecc/1, compile_script/1,
   29:          compile_mib/1, good_citizen/1, deep_cwd/1, arg_overflow/1,
   30:          make_dep_options/1,
   31:          unicode_paths/1,
   32:          features_erlc_describe/1,
   33:          features_erlc_unknown/1,
   34:          features_directives/1,
   35:          features_atom_warnings/1,
   36:          features_macros/1,
   37:          features_disable/1,
   38:          features_all/1,
   39:          features_load/1,
   40:          features_runtime/1,
   41:          features_include/1,
   42:          features/1]).
   43: 
   44: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() ->
   49:     [{group,with_server},{group,without_server},
   50:      {group,features_with_server}].
   51: 
   52: groups() ->
   53:     Tests = tests(),
   54:     [{with_server,[],Tests},
   55:      {features_with_server,[],feature_tests()},
   56:      {without_server,[],Tests ++ feature_tests()}].
   57: 
   58: tests() ->
   59:     [compile_erl, compile_yecc, compile_script, compile_mib,
   60:      good_citizen, deep_cwd, arg_overflow, make_dep_options,
   61:      unicode_paths].
   62: 
   63: feature_tests() ->
   64:     [features_erlc_describe,
   65:      features_erlc_unknown,
   66:      features_directives,
   67:      features_atom_warnings,
   68:      features_macros,
   69:      features_disable,
   70:      features_all,
   71:      features_load,
   72:      features_runtime,
   73:      features_include,
   74:      features].
   75: 
   76: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   77:     Config.
   78: 
   79: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   80:     ok.
   81: 
   82: init_per_group(with_server, Config) ->
   83:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   84:     Config;
   85: init_per_group(features_with_server, Config) ->
   86:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "yes"),
   87:     timer:sleep(12 * 1000),
   88:     Config;
   89: init_per_group(without_server, Config) ->
   90:     os:putenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER", "no"),
   91:     Config;
   92: init_per_group(_, Config) ->
   93:     Config.
   94: 
   95: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
   96:     os:unsetenv("ERLC_USE_SERVER"),
   97:     os:unsetenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES"),
   98:     Config.
   99: 
  100: init_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  101:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  102:         true ->
  103:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  104:         false ->
  105:             ok
  106:         end,
  107:     Config.
  108: 
  109: end_per_testcase(TestCase, Config) ->
  110:     case lists:member(TestCase, feature_tests()) of
  111:         true ->
  112:             os:putenv("OTP_TEST_FEATURES", "true");
  113:         false ->
  114:             ok
  115:         end,
  116:     Config.
  117: 
  118: 
  119: %% Copy from erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl.
  120: 
  121: -record(person, {name, shoe_size}).
  122: 
  123: %% Tests that compiling Erlang source code works.
  124: 
  125: compile_erl(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  126:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  127:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  128:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  129: 
  130:     %% By default, warnings are now turned on.
  131:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, FileName, "",
  132:                ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$", "_OK_"]),
  133: 
  134:     %% Test that the compiled file is where it should be,
  135:     %% and that it is runnable.
  136: 
  137:     {module, erl_test_ok} = code:load_abs(filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok")),
  138:     42 = erl_test_ok:shoe_size(#person{shoe_size=42}),
  139:     code:purge(erl_test_ok),
  140: 
  141:     %% Try disabling warnings.
  142: 
  143:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  144: 
  145:     %% Try treating warnings as errors.
  146: 
  147:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-Werror",
  148:                ["compile: warnings being treated as errors\$",
  149:                 "function foo/0 is unused\$", "_ERROR_"]),
  150: 
  151:     %% Check a bad file.
  152: 
  153:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_bad.erl"),
  154:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "",
  155:                ["function non_existing/1 undefined\$",
  156:                 "_ERROR_"]),
  157:     ok.
  158: 
  159: %% Test that compiling yecc source code works.
  160: 
  161: compile_yecc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  162:     {SrcDir, _, OutDir} = get_dirs(Config),
  163:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  164:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_ok.yrl"),
  165:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W0", ["_OK_"]),
  166:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  167: 
  168:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "yecc_test_bad.yrl"),
  169:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "-W0",
  170:                ["Nonterminals is missing\$",
  171:                 "rootsymbol form is not a nonterminal\$",
  172:                 "undefined nonterminal: form\$",
  173:                 "_ERROR_"]),
  174:     exists(filename:join(OutDir, "yecc_test_ok.erl")),
  175:     ok.
  176: 
  177: %% Test that compiling start scripts works.
  178: 
  179: compile_script(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  180:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  181:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_ok.script"),
  182:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  183:     true = exists(filename:join(OutDir, "start_ok.boot")),
  184: 
  185:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "start_bad.script"),
  186:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "", ["syntax error before:", "_ERROR_"]),
  187:     ok.
  188: 
  189: %% Test that compiling SNMP mibs works.
  190: 
  191: compile_mib(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  192:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  193:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "GOOD-MIB.mib"),
  194:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  195:     Output = filename:join(OutDir, "GOOD-MIB.bin"),
  196:     true = exists(Output),
  197: 
  198:     %% Try -W option.
  199: 
  200:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  201:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W",
  202:         ["_OK_"]),
  203:     true = exists(Output),
  204: 
  205:     %% Try -W option and more verbose.
  206: 
  207:     ok = file:delete(Output),
  208:     case os:type() of
  209:         {unix,_} ->
  210:             run_stderr(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-W +'{verbosity,info}'",
  211:                        ["\\[GOOD-MIB[.]mib\\]\\[INF\\]: No accessfunction for 'sysDescr' => using default",
  212:                         "_OK_"]),
  213:             true = exists(Output),
  214:             ok = file:delete(Output);
  215:         _ -> ok				%Don't bother -- too much work.
  216:     end,
  217: 
  218:     %% Try a bad file.
  219: 
  220:     BadFile = filename:join(SrcDir, "BAD-MIB.mib"),
  221:     run_stderr(Config, Cmd, BadFile, "",
  222:                ["BAD-MIB.mib: 1: syntax error before: mibs\$",
  223:                 "compilation_failed_ERROR_"]),
  224: 
  225:     %% Make sure that no -I option works.
  226: 
  227:     NewCmd = erlc() ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
  228:     run(Config, NewCmd, FileName, "", ["_OK_"]),
  229:     true = exists(Output),
  230: 
  231:     ok.
  232: 
  233: %% Checks that 'erlc' doesn't eat any input (important when called from a
  234: %% shell script with redirected input).
  235: good_citizen(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  236:     case os:type() of
  237:         {unix, _} ->
  238:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  239:             Answer = filename:join(PrivDir, "answer"),
  240:             Script = filename:join(PrivDir, "test_script"),
  241:             Test = filename:join(PrivDir, "test.erl"),
  242:             S = ["#! /bin/sh\n", "erlc ", Test, "\n",
  243:                  "read reply\n", "echo $reply\n"],
  244:             ok = file:write_file(Script, S),
  245:             ok = file:write_file(Test, "-module(test).\n"),
  246:             Cmd = "echo y | sh " ++ Script ++ " > " ++ Answer,
  247:             os:cmd(Cmd),
  248:             {ok, Answer0} = file:read_file(Answer),
  249:             [$y|_] = binary_to_list(Answer0),
  250:             ok;
  251:         _ ->
  252:             {skip, "Unix specific"}
  253:     end.
  254: 
  255: %% Make sure that compiling an Erlang module deep down in
  256: %% in a directory with more than 255 characters works.
  257: deep_cwd(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  258:     case os:type() of
  259:         {unix, _} ->
  260:             PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  261:             deep_cwd_1(PrivDir);
  262:         _ ->
  263:             {skip, "Only a problem on Unix"}
  264:     end.
  265: 
  266: deep_cwd_1(PrivDir) ->
  267:     DeepDir0 = filename:join(PrivDir, lists:duplicate(128, $a)),
  268:     DeepDir = filename:join(DeepDir0, lists:duplicate(128, $b)),
  269:     ok = filelib:ensure_dir(filename:join(DeepDir,"any_file")),
  270:     ok = file:set_cwd(DeepDir),
  271:     ok = file:write_file("test.erl", "-module(test).\n\n"),
  272:     io:format("~s\n", [os:cmd("erlc test.erl")]),
  273:     true = filelib:is_file("test.beam"),
  274:     ok.
  275: 
  276: %% Test that a large number of command line switches does not
  277: %% overflow the argument buffer
  278: arg_overflow(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  279:     {SrcDir, _OutDir, Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  280:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  281:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  282:     %% Each -D option will be expanded to three arguments when
  283:     %% invoking 'erl'.
  284:     NumDOptions = num_d_options(),
  285:     Args = lists:flatten([ ["-D", integer_to_list(N, 36), "=1 "] ||
  286:                            N <- lists:seq(1, NumDOptions) ]),
  287:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, Args,
  288:         ["Warning: function foo/0 is unused\$",
  289:          "_OK_"]),
  290:     ok.
  291: 
  292: num_d_options() ->
  293:     case {os:type(),os:version()} of
  294:         {{win32,_},_} ->
  295:             %% The maximum size of a command line in the command
  296:             %% shell on Windows is 8191 characters.
  297:             %% Each -D option is expanded to "@dv NN 1", i.e.
  298:             %% 8 characters. (Numbers up to 1295 can be expressed
  299:             %% as two 36-base digits.)
  300:             1000;
  301:         {{unix,linux},Version} when Version < {2,6,23} ->
  302:             %% On some older 64-bit versions of Linux, the maximum number
  303:             %% of arguments is 16383.
  304:             %% See: http://www.in-ulm.de/~mascheck/various/argmax/
  305:             5440;
  306:         {{unix,darwin},{Major,_,_}} when Major >= 11 ->
  307:             %% "getconf ARG_MAX" still reports 262144 (as in previous
  308:             %% version of MacOS X), but the useful space seem to have
  309:             %% shrunk significantly (or possibly the number of arguments).
  310:             %% 7673
  311:             7500;
  312:         {_,_} ->
  313:             12000
  314:     end.
  315: 
  316: erlc() ->
  317:     case os:find_executable("erlc") of
  318:         false ->
  319:             ct:fail("Can't find erlc");
  320:         Erlc ->
  321:             "\"" ++ Erlc ++ "\""
  322:     end.
  323: 
  324: make_dep_options(Config) ->
  325:     {SrcDir,OutDir,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  326:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief",
  327:     FileName = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_ok.erl"),
  328:     BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.beam"),
  329: 
  330:     DepRE = ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  331:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  332:              "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  333:              "_OK_"],
  334: 
  335:     DepRETarget =
  336:     ["^target: \\\\$",
  337:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  338:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  339:      "_OK_"],
  340: 
  341:     DepREMP =
  342:     ["/erl_test_ok[.]beam: \\\\$",
  343:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok[.]erl \\\\$",
  344:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl$",
  345:      [],
  346:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test.hrl:$",
  347:      "_OK_"],
  348: 
  349:     DepREMissing =
  350:     ["/erl_test_missing_header[.]beam: \\\\$",
  351:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header[.]erl \\\\$",
  352:      "/erlc_SUITE_data/include/erl_test[.]hrl \\\\$",
  353:      "missing.hrl$",
  354:      "_OK_"],
  355: 
  356:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  357: 
  358:     %% Test plain -M
  359:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M", DepRE),
  360:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  361: 
  362:     %% Test -MF File
  363:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  364:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++DepFile, ["_OK_"]),
  365:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  366:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  367:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  368: 
  369:     %% Test -MD
  370:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD", ["_OK_"]),
  371:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  372:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  373:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  374:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  375: 
  376:     %% Test -M -MT Target
  377:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MT target", DepRETarget),
  378:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  379: 
  380:     %% Test -MF File -MT Target
  381:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  382:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  383:         ["_OK_"]),
  384:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  385:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  386:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  387:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  388: 
  389:     %% Test -MD -MT Target
  390:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MD -MT target", ["_OK_"]),
  391:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  392:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  393:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  394:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  395: 
  396:     %% Test -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  397:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  398:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  399:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MQ target", DepRETarget),
  400:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  401: 
  402:     %% Test -M -MP
  403:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-M -MP", DepREMP),
  404:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  405: 
  406:     %% Test -M -MG
  407:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  408:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-M -MG", DepREMissing),
  409:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  410: 
  411:     %%
  412:     %% check the above variants with side-effect -MMD
  413:     %%
  414: 
  415:     %% since compiler is run on the erlang code a warning will be
  416:     %% issued by the compiler, match that.
  417:     WarningRE =
  418:          "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_ok.erl:[0-9]+:[0-9]+: "
  419:         "Warning: function foo/0 is unused$",
  420:     ErrorRE = "/erlc_SUITE_data/src/erl_test_missing_header.erl:"
  421:         "[0-9]+:[0-9]+: can't find include file \"missing.hrl\"$",
  422: 
  423:     DepRE_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRE),
  424:     DepRETarget_MMD = insert_before("_OK_", WarningRE, DepRETarget),
  425:     DepREMP_MMD = insert_before("_OK_",WarningRE,DepREMP),
  426:     DepREMissing_MMD = (insert_before("_OK_",ErrorRE,DepREMissing)--
  427:                             ["_OK_"]) ++ ["_ERROR_"],
  428:     CompRE = [WarningRE,"_OK_"],
  429: 
  430: 
  431:     %% Test plain -MMD -M
  432:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M", DepRE_MMD),
  433:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  434:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  435: 
  436:     %% Test -MMD -MF File
  437:     DepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "my.deps"),
  438:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++DepFile, CompRE),
  439:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(DepFile),
  440:     verify_result(binary_to_list(MFBin)++["_OK_"], DepRE),
  441:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  442:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  443: 
  444:     %% Test -MMD -MD
  445:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD", CompRE),
  446:     MDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  447:     {ok,MFBin} = file:read_file(MDFile),
  448:     file:delete(MDFile), %% used further down!
  449:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  450:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  451: 
  452:     %% Test -MMD -M -MT Target
  453:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MT target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  454:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  455:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  456: 
  457:     %% Test -MMD -MF File -MT Target
  458:     TargetDepFile = filename:join(OutDir, "target.deps"),
  459:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MF "++TargetDepFile++" -MT target",
  460:         CompRE),
  461:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetDepFile),
  462:     verify_result(binary_to_list(TargetBin)++["_OK_"], DepRETarget),
  463:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  464:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  465:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  466: 
  467:     %% Test -MMD -MD -MT Target
  468:     run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -MD -MT target", CompRE),
  469:     TargetMDFile = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_ok.Pbeam"),
  470:     {ok,TargetBin} = file:read_file(TargetMDFile),
  471:     file:delete(TargetDepFile),
  472:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  473:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  474: 
  475:     %% Test -MMD -M -MQ Target. (Note: Passing a $ on the command line
  476:     %% portably for Unix and Windows is tricky, so we will just test
  477:     %% that MQ works at all.)
  478:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MQ target", DepRETarget_MMD),
  479:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  480:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  481: 
  482:     %% Test -MMD -M -MP
  483:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, FileName, "-MMD -M -MP", DepREMP_MMD),
  484:     true = exists(BeamFileName),
  485:     file:delete(BeamFileName),
  486: 
  487:     %% Test -MMD -M -MG
  488:     MissingHeader = filename:join(SrcDir, "erl_test_missing_header.erl"),
  489:     run_stdout(Config, Cmd, MissingHeader, "-MMD -M -MG", DepREMissing_MMD),
  490:     false = exists(BeamFileName),
  491:     ok.
  492: 
  493: unicode_paths(Config) ->
  494:     case {os:type(), file:native_name_encoding()} of
  495:         {{win32,_}, _} -> {skip, "Unicode paths not supported on windows"};
  496:         {_,latin1} -> {skip, "Cannot interpret unicode filenames when native_name_encoding is latin1"};
  497:         _ ->
  498:             DepRE = ["_OK_"],
  499:             {SrcDir,OutDir0,Cmd0} = get_cmd(Config),
  500:             OutDir = filename:join(OutDir0,"😀"),
  501:             ok = case file:make_dir(OutDir) of
  502:                 {error, eexist} -> ok;
  503:                 ok -> ok;
  504:                 E -> E
  505:             end,
  506:             Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " +brief -o "++OutDir,
  507:             FileName = filename:join([SrcDir, "😀", "erl_test_unicode.erl"]),
  508:             BeamFileName = filename:join(OutDir, "erl_test_unicode.beam"),
  509:             run(Config, Cmd, FileName, "", DepRE),
  510:             true = exists(BeamFileName),
  511:             file:delete(BeamFileName),
  512:             file:delete(OutDir),
  513:             ok
  514:     end.
  515: 
  516: %%% Tests related to the features mechanism
  517: %% Support macros and functions
  518: -define(OK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_OK_"]).
  519: -define(NOTOK(Lines), Lines ++ ["_ERROR_"]).
  520: 
  521: flatfmt(FStr, Args) ->
  522:     lists:flatten(io_lib:format(FStr, Args)).
  523: 
  524: defopt(Name) -> flatfmt("-D~w", [Name]).
  525: defopt(Name, Value) -> flatfmt("-D~w=~w", [Name, Value]).
  526: 
  527: longopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-enable-feature ~w", [Ftr]);
  528: longopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("-disable-feature ~w", [Ftr]).
  529: 
  530: plusopt(enable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, enable}\"", [Ftr]);
  531: plusopt(disable, Ftr) -> flatfmt("+\"{feature, ~w, disable}\"", [Ftr]).
  532: 
  533: options(Opts) -> lists:flatten(lists:join(" ", Opts)).
  534: 
  535: peer(Args) ->
  536:     {ok, Peer, Node} =
  537:         ?CT_PEER(#{args => Args,
  538:                    connection => 0}),
  539:     {Peer, Node}.
  540: 
  541: %% Error messages to expect
  542: nosingle(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' does not exist", [Ftr]).
  543: 
  544: nomultiple(Ftrs) ->
  545:     Q = fun(A) -> flatfmt("'~w'", [A]) end,
  546:     flatfmt("the features ~s and '~w' do not exist",
  547:             [lists:join(", ",
  548:                         lists:map(Q, lists:droplast(Ftrs))),
  549:              lists:last(Ftrs)]).
  550: 
  551: not_config(Ftr) -> flatfmt("the feature '~w' is not configurable", [Ftr]).
  552: 
  553: syntax(Offender) -> flatfmt("syntax error before: ~w", [Offender]).
  554: 
  555: misplaced_directive() ->
  556:     "feature directive not allowed after exports or record definitions".
  557: 
  558: atom_warning(Atom, Ftr) ->
  559:     flatfmt("atom '~w' is reserved in the experimental feature '~w'",
  560:             [Atom, Ftr]).
  561: 
  562: compile_fun(Config) ->
  563:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd} = get_cmd(Config),
  564:     Compile = fun(FName, Opts, Expected) ->
  565:                       Path = case FName of
  566:                                  "" -> "";
  567:                                  FName -> filename:join(SrcDir, FName)
  568:                              end,
  569:                       run(Config, Cmd, Path, Opts, Expected)
  570:               end,
  571:     {Compile, SrcDir, OutDir}.
  572: 
  573: %% Tests
  574: features_erlc_describe(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  575:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  576: 
  577:     Compile("", "-list-features",
  578:             ?NOTOK(["Available features:",
  579:                     "approved_ftr_1",
  580:                     "approved_ftr_2",
  581:                     "experimental_ftr_1",
  582:                     "experimental_ftr_2"])),
  583: 
  584:     Compile("", "-describe-feature experimental_ftr_1",
  585:             ?NOTOK(["experimental_ftr_1",
  586:                     "Type",
  587:                     "Status",
  588:                     "Keywords",
  589:                     skip_lines])),
  590: 
  591:     Compile("", "-describe-feature loop_macro",
  592:             ?NOTOK(["Unknown feature: loop_macro"])).
  593: 
  594: features_erlc_unknown(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  595:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  596: 
  597:     %% Test for single invalid feature, using long and +options
  598:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  599:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  600:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  601:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  602:     Compile("nofile.erl", longopt(disable, no_ftr),
  603:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  604:     Compile("nofile.erl", plusopt(disable, no_ftr),
  605:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(no_ftr)])),
  606: 
  607:     %% Test for multiple invalid features
  608:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  609:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  610:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  611:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  612:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  613:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  614:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  615:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  616:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  617:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  618:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  619:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  620:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  621:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  622: 
  623:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  624:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  625:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  626:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  627:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr)]),
  628:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr])])),
  629: 
  630:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  631:                                    longopt(enable, un_ftr),
  632:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  633:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  634:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  635:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  636:                                    plusopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  637:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  638: 
  639:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([longopt(enable, no_ftr),
  640:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  641:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  642:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  643:     Compile("nofile.erl", options([plusopt(enable, no_ftr),
  644:                                    plusopt(enable, un_ftr),
  645:                                    longopt(disable, mis_ftr)]),
  646:             ?NOTOK([nomultiple([no_ftr, un_ftr, mis_ftr])])),
  647: 
  648:     %% Rejected and permanent features can not be configured.
  649:     %% Rejected feature
  650:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  651:             options([longopt(enable, rejected_ftr)]),
  652:             ?NOTOK([not_config(rejected_ftr),
  653:                     skip_lines])),
  654: 
  655:     %% Permanent feature
  656:     Compile("nofile.erl",
  657:             options([longopt(enable, permanent_ftr)]),
  658:             ?NOTOK([not_config(permanent_ftr),
  659:                     skip_lines])).
  660: 
  661: features_directives(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  662:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  663: 
  664:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (enable)
  665:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  666:             options([defopt(misplaced_enable)]),
  667:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  668:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  669:                     skip_lines])),
  670:     %% Test for misplaced feature directive (disable)
  671:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  672:             options([defopt(misplaced_disable)]),
  673:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
  674:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature.*misplaced",
  675:                     skip_lines])),
  676: 
  677:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (enable)
  678:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  679:             options([defopt(enable_unknown)]),
  680:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  681:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  682:                     skip_lines])),
  683:     %% Test for unknown feature in directive (disable)
  684:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  685:             options([defopt(disable_unknown)]),
  686:             ?NOTOK([nosingle(unlesser),
  687:                     "[0-9]+\| -feature",
  688:                     skip_lines])),
  689: 
  690:     %% Enable a feature on the command line and disable the same in a
  691:     %% directive
  692:     Compile("f_directives.erl",
  693:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  694:                      defopt(disable_exp2),
  695:                      defopt(no_dir_enable_exp2)]),
  696:             ?OK([])).
  697: 
  698: features_atom_warnings(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  699:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  700: 
  701:     %% Check for keyword warnings.  Not all are checked.
  702:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords",
  703:             ?OK([atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  704:                  skip_lines,
  705:                  atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  706:                  skip_lines,
  707:                  atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  708:                  skip_lines])),
  709: 
  710:     %% Check for keyword warnings, resulting in error.
  711:     %% Not all warnings are checked.
  712:     Compile("ignorant.erl", "+warn_keywords -Werror",
  713:             ?NOTOK([skip_lines,
  714:                     atom_warning(until, experimental_ftr_2),
  715:                     skip_lines,
  716:                     atom_warning(ifn, experimental_ftr_1),
  717:                     skip_lines,
  718:                     atom_warning(while, experimental_ftr_2),
  719:                     skip_lines])),
  720: 
  721:     %% File has quoted atoms which are keywords in experimental_ftr_2.
  722:     %% We should see no warnings.
  723:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  724:                                 "+warn_keywords"]),
  725:             ?OK([])).
  726: 
  727: features(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  728:     {Compile, _, _} = compile_fun(Config),
  729: 
  730:     %% Simple compile - baseline for this file.  Really needed?
  731:     %% It uses atoms that are keywords in  experimental features.
  732:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  733:             [],
  734:             ?OK([])),
  735: 
  736:     %% Enable and disable the same feature on the command line to
  737:     %% check that the ordering semantics is honoured.
  738:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  739:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  740:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  741:             ?OK([])),
  742: 
  743:     %% As above, with +options
  744:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  745:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  746:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  747:             ?OK([])),
  748: 
  749:     %% Mixed options
  750:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  751:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  752:                      plusopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  753:             ?OK([])),
  754: 
  755:     %% Mixed options
  756:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  757:             options([plusopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  758:                      longopt(disable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  759:             ?OK([])),
  760: 
  761:     %% Enable a feature and see errors
  762:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  763:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1)]),
  764:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
  765:                     skip_lines,
  766:                     syntax(ifn),
  767:                     skip_lines])),
  768: 
  769:     %% Enable another feature and see other errors
  770:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  771:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  772:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  773:                     skip_lines,
  774:                     syntax(until),
  775:                     skip_lines,
  776:                     syntax(while),
  777:                     skip_lines,
  778:                     syntax(while),
  779:                     skip_lines,
  780:                     syntax(until),
  781:                     skip_lines])),
  782: 
  783:     %% Enable both features and see even more errors
  784:     Compile("ignorant.erl",
  785:             options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  786:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  787:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
  788:                     skip_lines,
  789:                     syntax(until),
  790:                     skip_lines,
  791:                     syntax(ifn),
  792:                     skip_lines,
  793:                     syntax(while),
  794:                     skip_lines,
  795:                     syntax(until),
  796:                     skip_lines,
  797:                     syntax(ifn),
  798:                     skip_lines])),
  799: 
  800:     ok.
  801: 
  802: features_macros(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  803:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  804: 
  805:     Compile("f_macros.erl", "", ?OK([])),
  806: 
  807:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  808:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  809:                    erpc:call(Node, f_macros, Fun, [])
  810:            end,
  811: 
  812:     {module, f_macros} =
  813:         erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  814: 
  815:     true = Call(Node0, has_experimental),
  816:     false = Call(Node0, has_hindley_milner),
  817:     false = Call(Node0, with_hm),
  818:     false = Call(Node0, uses_experimental),
  819:     false = Call(Node0, uses_exp2),
  820: 
  821:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  822: 
  823:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  824:             ?OK([])),
  825: 
  826:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  827: 
  828:     true = erpc:call(Node1, erlang, module_loaded, [erl_features]),
  829: 
  830:     %% Starting from OTP 26, compile-time features don't need to be
  831:     %% enabled in the runtime system.
  832:     {module, f_macros} =
  833:         erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  834:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  835:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_1] =
  836:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [f_macros]),
  837: 
  838:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  839: 
  840:     %% Restart with feature enabled in runtime
  841:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  842:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1"]),
  843:     %% Now we can load it
  844:     {module, f_macros} =
  845:         erpc:call(Node2, code, load_file, [f_macros]),
  846: 
  847:     true = Call(Node2, uses_experimental),
  848:     false = Call(Node2, uses_exp2),
  849:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  850: 
  851:     Compile("f_macros.erl", longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2),
  852:             ?OK([])),
  853:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  854:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  855:     false = Call(Node3, uses_experimental),
  856:     true = Call(Node3, uses_exp2),
  857:     peer:stop(Peer3),
  858: 
  859:     Compile("f_macros.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  860:                                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  861:             ?OK([])),
  862:     {Peer4, Node4} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  863:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  864:                            "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  865:     true = Call(Node4, uses_experimental),
  866:     true = Call(Node4, uses_exp2),
  867:     peer:stop(Peer4),
  868: 
  869:     ok.
  870: 
  871: features_disable(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  872:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  873: 
  874:     Call = fun(Node, Fun) ->
  875:                    erpc:call(Node, f_disable, Fun, [])
  876:            end,
  877: 
  878:     Compile("f_disable.erl", options([longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_1),
  879:                                       longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
  880:             ?OK([])),
  881: 
  882:     {Peer, Node} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  883:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_1",
  884:                          "-enable-feature","experimental_ftr_2"]),
  885:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  886:     [approved_ftr_2] =
  887:         erpc:call(Node, erl_features, used, [f_disable]),
  888: 
  889:     no_experimental = Call(Node, no_experimental),
  890:     no_exp2 = Call(Node, no_ftrs),
  891:     peer:stop(Peer),
  892: 
  893:     ok.
  894: 
  895: features_all(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  896:     {Compile, _, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  897: 
  898:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(enable, all),
  899:             ?OK([])),
  900: 
  901:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  902:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  903:     [approved_ftr_1,approved_ftr_2,experimental_ftr_1,experimental_ftr_2] =
  904:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  905:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  906: 
  907:     Compile("foo.erl", longopt(disable, all),
  908:             ?OK([])),
  909: 
  910:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
  911:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  912:     [] = erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  913:     {module, foo} = erpc:call(Node1, code, load_file, [foo]),
  914:     peer:stop(Peer1),
  915: 
  916:     Compile("foo.erl", options([longopt(disable, all),
  917:                                 longopt(enable, approved_ftr_2)]),
  918:             ?OK([])),
  919: 
  920:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
  921:                            "-disable-feature", "all"]),
  922:     %% Check features enabled during compilation
  923:     [approved_ftr_2] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, used, [foo]),
  924:     peer:stop(Peer2),
  925: 
  926:     ok.
  927: 
  928: features_load(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  929:     {_Compile, SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  930: 
  931:     %% Note that we put SrcDir in the load path as there is where we
  932:     %% have the precompiled beam file.
  933:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", SrcDir]),
  934: 
  935:     %% For a file compiled with an older version, i.e., with no Meta
  936:     %% chunk, we should see no used features.
  937:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [older]),
  938:     %% .. and we should be able to load it.
  939:     {module,older} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [older]),
  940: 
  941:     [] = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used,
  942:                    [filename:join(SrcDir, "older.beam")]),
  943: 
  944:     %% Behaviour for non existent modules
  945:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, [none]),
  946:     not_found = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, used, ["none.beam"]),
  947:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  948: 
  949:     ok.
  950: 
  951: features_runtime(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  952:     AllFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  953:                approved_ftr_2,
  954:                experimental_ftr_1,
  955:                experimental_ftr_2,
  956:                permanent_ftr,
  957:                rejected_ftr],
  958:     ConfigFtrs = [approved_ftr_1,
  959:                   approved_ftr_2,
  960:                   experimental_ftr_1,
  961:                   experimental_ftr_2],
  962:     Approved = [approved_ftr_2,
  963:                 approved_ftr_1],
  964: 
  965:     {_Compile, _SrcDir, _OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
  966: 
  967:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer([]),
  968: 
  969:     %% Get all known features
  970:     AllFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, all, []),
  971:     ConfigFtrs = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, configurable, []),
  972:     Approved =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, enabled, []),
  973: 
  974:     %% Keywords from enabled (here the approved) features
  975:     %% (does not need to be quoted since it comes from the peer node)
  976:     [unless] =  erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, keywords, []),
  977: 
  978:     Info = erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [permanent_ftr]),
  979:     true = is_map(Info),
  980:     true = lists:all(fun(K) -> is_map_key(K, Info) end,
  981:                      [status,type,description,short,experimental]),
  982: 
  983:     %% Try to get info for unknown feature - raises error
  984:     try
  985:         erpc:call(Node0, erl_features, info, [unknown_feature]) of
  986:         Value ->
  987:             ct:fail({value_returned_for_unknown_feature, Value})
  988:     catch
  989:         error:{exception, invalid_feature, _} ->
  990:             ok;
  991:         Class:Reason ->
  992:             ct:fail({unexpected_exception, {Class, Reason}})
  993:     end,
  994: 
  995:     peer:stop(Peer0),
  996: 
  997:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
  998:     [experimental_ftr_2, approved_ftr_2, approved_ftr_1] =
  999:         erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, enabled, []),
 1000:     [while, until, unless] =  erpc:call(Node1, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1001: 
 1002:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1003: 
 1004:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-disable-feature", "all"]),
 1005:     [] = erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, enabled, []),
 1006:     [] =  erpc:call(Node2, erl_features, keywords, []),
 1007: 
 1008:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1009:     ok.
 1010: 
 1011: features_include(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1012:     {Compile, _SrcDir, OutDir} = compile_fun(Config),
 1013: 
 1014:     %% Ensure that the feature experimental_ftr_1 is enabled in the
 1015:     %% include file and generates an error
 1016:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", [],
 1017:             ?NOTOK([syntax(ifn),
 1018:                     skip_lines])),
 1019: 
 1020:     %% This will disable a feature after a record has been defined.
 1021:     %% Error expected
 1022:     Compile("f_include_1.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1023:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1024:                     skip_lines])),
 1025: 
 1026:     %% Ensure that the macro knows that experimental_ftr_1 is enabled
 1027:     %% in the include file.
 1028:     Compile("f_include_2.erl", defopt(end_include),
 1029:             ?OK([])),
 1030: 
 1031:     {Peer0, Node0} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1032:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_1"]),
 1033: 
 1034:     {module, f_include_2} = erpc:call(Node0, code, load_file, [f_include_2]),
 1035:     active = erpc:call(Node0, f_include_2, foo, [2]),
 1036:     peer:stop(Peer0),
 1037: 
 1038:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", [],
 1039:             ?OK([])),
 1040: 
 1041:     {Peer1, Node1} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1042:                            "-enable-feature", "all"]),
 1043:     exp2_enabled = erpc:call(Node1, f_include_3, foo, [1]),
 1044:     peer:stop(Peer1),
 1045: 
 1046:     Compile("f_include_3.erl", defopt(end_prefix),
 1047:             ?NOTOK([misplaced_directive(),
 1048:                     "experimental_ftr_2",
 1049:                     skip_lines])),
 1050: 
 1051:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl", defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1052:             ?OK([])),
 1053:     {Peer2, Node2} = peer(["-pa", OutDir]),
 1054:     {conditional, on, until} = erpc:call(Node2, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1055:     peer:stop(Peer2),
 1056: 
 1057:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1058:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 0),
 1059:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1060:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1061:                     skip_lines])),
 1062: 
 1063:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1064:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 1)]),
 1065:             ?NOTOK([syntax(until),
 1066:                     skip_lines])),
 1067: 
 1068:     Compile("f_include_exp2.erl",
 1069:             options([defopt(enable_exp_2, 2),
 1070:                      longopt(enable, experimental_ftr_2)]),
 1071:             ?OK([])),
 1072: 
 1073:     {Peer3, Node3} = peer(["-pa", OutDir,
 1074:                            "-enable-feature", "experimental_ftr_2"]),
 1075:     {conditional, off, none} = erpc:call(Node3, f_include_exp2, foo, []),
 1076: 
 1077:     [approved_ftr_1, approved_ftr_2, experimental_ftr_2] =
 1078:         erpc:call(Node3, erl_features, used, [f_include_exp2]),
 1079:     peer:stop(Peer3),
 1080: 
 1081:     ok.
 1082: 
 1083: %% Runs a command.
 1084: 
 1085: run_stdout(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1086:     case os:type() of
 1087:         {unix,_} ->
 1088:             %% The output is expected to be printed to stdout.
 1089:             Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name ++ " 2>/dev/null",
 1090:             io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1091:             Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1092:             verify_result(Result, Expect);
 1093:         _ ->
 1094:             run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect)
 1095:     end.
 1096: 
 1097: run_stderr(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1098:     case os:type() of
 1099:         {unix,_} ->
 1100:             %% The output is expected to be printed to stderr.
 1101:             Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name ++ " >/dev/null",
 1102:             io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1103:             Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1104:             verify_result(Result, Expect);
 1105:         _ ->
 1106:             run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect)
 1107:     end.
 1108: 
 1109: run(Config, Cmd0, Name, Options, Expect) ->
 1110:     Cmd = Cmd0 ++ " " ++ Options ++ " " ++ Name,
 1111:     io:format("~ts", [Cmd]),
 1112:     Result = run_command(Config, Cmd),
 1113:     verify_result(Result, Expect).
 1114: 
 1115: verify_result(Result, Expect) ->
 1116:     Messages = split(Result, [], []),
 1117:     io:format("Result: ~p", [Messages]),
 1118:     io:format("Expected: ~p", [Expect]),
 1119:     match_messages_x(Messages, Expect).
 1120: 
 1121: %% insert What before Item, crash if Item is not found
 1122: insert_before(Item, What, [Item|List]) ->
 1123:     [What,Item|List];
 1124: insert_before(Item, What, [Other|List]) ->
 1125:     [Other|insert_before(Item, What, List)].
 1126: 
 1127: split([$\n|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1128:     split(Rest, [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]);
 1129: split([$\r|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1130:     split(Rest, Current, Lines);
 1131: split([Char|Rest], Current, Lines) ->
 1132:     split(Rest, [Char|Current], Lines);
 1133: split([], [], Lines) ->
 1134:     lists:reverse(Lines);
 1135: split([], Current, Lines) ->
 1136:     split([], [], [lists:reverse(Current)|Lines]).
 1137: 
 1138: match_messages_x(Msgs0, Regexps0) ->
 1139:     Msgs = lists:droplast(Msgs0),
 1140:     Regexps = lists:droplast(Regexps0),
 1141:     Return = lists:last(Msgs0),
 1142:     ExpRet = lists:last(Regexps0),
 1143:     match_messages(Msgs, Regexps),
 1144:     match_one(Return, ExpRet).
 1145: 
 1146: match_messages(_, [skip_lines]) ->
 1147:     ok;
 1148: match_messages([_Msg|Rest1], [skip_one|Rest2]) ->
 1149:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1150: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1151:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1152:         match ->
 1153:             match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1154:         nomatch ->
 1155:             match_messages(Rest1, [skip_lines, Regexp|Rest2])
 1156:     end;
 1157: match_messages([Msg|Rest1], [Regexp|Rest2]) ->
 1158:     match_one(Msg, Regexp),
 1159:     match_messages(Rest1, Rest2);
 1160: match_messages([], [Expect|Rest]) ->
 1161:     ct:fail({too_few_messages, [Expect|Rest]});
 1162: match_messages([Msg|Rest], []) ->
 1163:     ct:fail({too_many_messages, [Msg|Rest]});
 1164: match_messages([], []) ->
 1165:     ok.
 1166: 
 1167: match_one(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1168:     case match(Msg, Regexp) of
 1169:         match ->
 1170:             ok;
 1171:         nomatch ->
 1172:             io:format("Not matching: ~s\n", [Msg]),
 1173:             io:format("Regexp      : ~s\n", [Regexp]),
 1174:             ct:fail(message_mismatch)
 1175:     end.
 1176: 
 1177: match(Msg, Regexp) ->
 1178:     re:run(Msg, Regexp, [{capture,none}, unicode]).
 1179: 
 1180: get_cmd(Cfg) ->
 1181:     {SrcDir, IncDir, OutDir} = get_dirs(Cfg),
 1182:     Cmd = erlc() ++ " -I" ++ IncDir ++ " -o" ++ OutDir ++ " ",
 1183:     {SrcDir, OutDir, Cmd}.
 1184: 
 1185: get_dirs(Cfg) ->
 1186:     DataDir = proplists:get_value(data_dir, Cfg),
 1187:     PrivDir = proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Cfg),
 1188:     SrcDir = filename:join(DataDir, "src"),
 1189:     IncDir = filename:join(DataDir, "include"),
 1190:     {SrcDir, IncDir, PrivDir}.
 1191: 
 1192: exists(Name) ->
 1193:     filelib:is_file(Name).
 1194: 
 1195: %% Runs the command using os:cmd/1.
 1196: %%
 1197: %% Returns the output from the command (as a list of characters with
 1198: %% embedded newlines).  The very last line will indicate the
 1199: %% exit status of the command, where _OK_ means zero, and _ERROR_
 1200: %% a non-zero exit status.
 1201: 
 1202: run_command(Config, Cmd) ->
 1203:     TmpDir = filename:join(proplists:get_value(priv_dir, Config), "tmp"),
 1204:     file:make_dir(TmpDir),
 1205:     {RunFile, Run, Script} = run_command(TmpDir, os:type(), Cmd),
 1206:     ok = file:write_file(RunFile, unicode:characters_to_binary(Script)),
 1207:     os:cmd(Run).
 1208: 
 1209: run_command(Dir, {win32, _}, Cmd) ->
 1210:     BatchFile = filename:join(Dir, "run.bat"),
 1211:     Run = re:replace(filename:rootname(BatchFile), "/", "\\",
 1212:                      [global,{return,list}]),
 1213:     {BatchFile,
 1214:      Run,
 1215:      ["@echo off\r\n",
 1216:       "set ERLC_EMULATOR=", os:find_executable("erl"), "\r\n",
 1217:       Cmd, "\r\n",
 1218:       "if errorlevel 1 echo _ERROR_\r\n",
 1219:       "if not errorlevel 1 echo _OK_\r\n"]};
 1220: run_command(Dir, {unix, _}, Cmd) ->
 1221:     Name = filename:join(Dir, "run"),
 1222:     {Name,
 1223:      "/bin/sh " ++ Name,
 1224:      ["#!/bin/sh\n",
 1225:       "ERLC_EMULATOR='",  os:find_executable("erl"), "'\n",
 1226:       "export ERLC_EMULATOR\n",
 1227:       Cmd, "\n",
 1228:       "case $? in\n",
 1229:       "  0) echo '_OK_';;\n",
 1230:       "  *) echo '_ERROR_';;\n",
 1231:       "esac\n"]};
 1232: run_command(_Dir, Other, _Cmd) ->
 1233:     ct:fail("Don't know how to test exit code for ~p", [Other]).
